what: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: Package simulating randomised clinical trials temporal trajectories health-related quality life (HRQoL) outcome, quantify effect sizes single-sampled HRQoL values end follow-area trajectories. Developed part INCEPT (Intensive Care Platform Trial) project (https://incept.dk/), primarily supported grant Sygeforsikringen “danmark” (https://www.sygeforsikring.dk/).

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: Website - stand-alone website full package documentation Health-related quality life trajectories critical illness: protocol Monte Carlo simulation study - protocol article Acta Anaesthesiologica Scandinavica outlining first scientific study use hrqolr

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: First, load package: preferred way design scenario using setup_scenario() function validate input give right format. Set verbose = FALSE silence validation results. Getting overview final scenario: scenario hand, can sample number example trajectories visualise :  sample_example_trajectories returns ggplot object, allowing fine-tune appearance needs. example, breaking apart trajectories arms apart facets hide legend (remember load ggplot2 first). , also set arm-level trajectory black make stand better:  can also summarise trajectories, e.g., inter-quartile ranges. ribbons become bit wonky end follow-due increasingly fewer observations might low:  scenario specification can, , used simulate desired number trials. default hrqolr print progress updates console (silence verbose = FALSE): Just printing returned object gives overview: returned object contains quite lot interesting information. example, summary statistics arm: –head--head comparisons arms:
code: library(hrqolr) #> Loading 'hrqolr' package v0.0.0.9051. #> For help, run 'help("hrqolr")' or check out https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr. scenario <- setup_scenario(     arms = c("A", "B"),     n_patients = 100,     sampling_frequency = 14,     index_hrqol = 0.0,     first_hrqol = 0.1,     final_hrqol = c(A = 0.8, B = 0.7),     acceleration_hrqol = c(A = 1.1, B = 1.0),          mortality = 0.4,     mortality_dampening = 0.0,     mortality_trajectory_shape = "exp_decay",     prop_mortality_benefitters = 0.0 ) #> Scenario-parameter validation: #> - arms                         valid as is   c("A", "B")    #> - n_patients                   expanded to   c(A = 100, B = 100)    #> - index_hrqol                  expanded to   c(A = 0, B = 0)    #> - first_hrqol                  expanded to   c(A = 0.1, B = 0.1)    #> - final_hrqol                  valid as is   c(A = 0.8, B = 0.7)    #> - acceleration_hrqol           valid as is   c(A = 1.1, B = 1)    #> - mortality                    expanded to   c(A = 0.4, B = 0.4)    #> - mortality_dampening          expanded to   c(A = 0, B = 0)    #> - mortality_trajectory_shape   expanded to   c(A = "exp_decay", B = "exp_decay")    #> - prop_mortality_benefitters   expanded to   c(A = 0, B = 0)    #> - sampling_frequency           expanded to   c(A = 14, B = 14) scenario #> - arms                                    A           B #> - n_patients                            100         100 #> - index_hrqol                             0           0 #> - first_hrqol                           0.1         0.1 #> - final_hrqol                           0.8         0.7 #> - acceleration_hrqol                    1.1           1 #> - mortality                             0.4         0.4 #> - mortality_dampening                     0 sample_example_trajectories(scenario, n_digits = 3) plot(example_trajs) library(ggplot2)   plot(example_trajs, arm_aes = list(colour = "black")) +     facet_wrap(~ arm) +     theme(legend.position = "none") plot(example_trajs, "summarise", ribbon_percentiles = c(0.25, 0.75)) sims <- simulate_trials(scenario) #> 2024-06-02 17:28:51: Estimating ground truth of arm 'A' (0 secs) #> 2024-06-02 Choices     "linear" "constant". f method = "constant" number 0 1     inclusive, indicating compromise left-     right-continuous step functions. y0 y1     values left right point value     y0 f == 0, y1 f == 1,      y0*(1-f)+y1*f intermediate values. way result     right-continuous f == 0 left-continuous f     == 1, even non-finite y values.

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: scenario object class 'hrqolr_scenario', output setup_scenario ... passed methods n_trials single integer, number trials simulate total n_patients_ground_truth single integer, many patients (per arm) use estimating ground truth n_example_trajectories_per_arm single integer, number example trajectories include returned object test_fun function used compare estimates. default welch_t_test (built hrqolr). Note function handle number arms provided. See Details . include_trial_results single logical, indicates whether trial-level results kept. Default FALSE resulting object may large many trials simulated. verbose single logical, function give progress timestamped updates? Default: TRUE n_digits single integer, number decimal places first HRQoL values patients. digits yield greater precision also cause longer run-times. valid_hrqol_range two-element numeric vector, lower upper bounds valid HRQoL values. default (c(-0.757, 1.0)) corresponds Danish EQ-5D-5L index values. alpha single numerical value [0, 1], desired type 1 error rate used comparing HRQoL arms. max_batch_size single integer, maximum number patients process batch. default use run one batch (.e. upper limit). seed single integer, optional seed reproducible pseudo-random number generation. Defaults deterministic value based arguments given (ensuring reproducibility default).

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: object class hrqolr_results, specialised list six elements: summary_stats contains summary statistics arm comparisons contains comparisons ground truth performance metrics args list arguments trial_results contains trial-level results, include_trial_results = TRUE example_trajectories contains example trajectories n_example_trajectories_per_arm greater 0 resource_use documents approximate run-time, peak memory use maximum cache size. information can helpful orchestration several (hundreds thousands) scenarios simulated parallel e.g. high-performance computing systems

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: test_fun hrqolr comes three built-test functions: welch_t_test bootstrap_estimates work two-armed trials, games_howell_test three-arm trials. use case requires, can specify test_fun. must accept five arguments: vals vector outcome values grps vector length vals grouping indices arms unique values grps vector na_replacement value put place NA's (patients outcome values available died follow-started) alpha significance level specified calling simulate_trials() --must return list six elements: comparator string, name comparator arm comparison target string, name target arm comparison est numeric, point estimate p_value numeric ci_lo numeric, lower bound confidence interval ci_hi numeric, upper bound confidence interval
